channel.title: Internet Explorer 9
channel.description:
http://www.pcworld.com/businesscenter/article/222216/four_ways_ie9_lets_you_surf_safer.html
There has been [url=http://news.google.com/news/more?pz=1&cf=all&topic=t&ncl=daDBOlfScNDHmiM7CZpCUVsBZvFWM]a rather large hype[/url] about Internet Explorer being, well, "better" "safer" "download it now cus its best browser omg"...

item.title: Internet Explorer 9
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“STH, post:11, topic:386543”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=482301.msg3533997#msg3533997 date=1300412004]

Nothing really matters unless it supports real standards for once, and I’m assuming it doesn’t…

Internet Explorer 9, debuting a full-featured browser that has proven to be the fastest, most standards-compliant IE version yet.

[/quote]

Yeah.
Most standards compliant IE version. Not standards compliant.[/quote]

Exactly what I was going to say.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Explorer 9
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Of course there are exceptions, but the overwhelming majority choose to stick to IE and IE only. Unfortunately.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Explorer 9
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:20, topic:386543”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=482301.msg3534288#msg3534288 date=1300436293]
I’d actually consider it good news. People, especially those who implement systems in large networks like colleges, schools, universities, etc, choose internet explorer over and over again, for whatever reason.

IE9 is a much better browser than previous versions, and because it will hold a large portion of the market (eventually) at least that portion will be using a decent browser now. After Microsoft waking up and realising they have some catching up to do, I’m willing to give them a chance.

[/quote]Whilst i agree with all ur sentiments in this thread, at my college they had IE removed from the boxes and replaced with FF.[/quote]At my school they actually installed firefox, IE, and chrome for people to chose from

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Explorer 9
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:18, topic:386543”]I’d actually consider it good news. People, especially those who implement systems in large networks like colleges, schools, universities, etc, choose internet explorer over and over again, for whatever reason.

IE9 is a much better browser than previous versions, and because it will hold a large portion of the market (eventually) at least that portion will be using a decent browser now. After Microsoft waking up and realising they have some catching up to do, I’m willing to give them a chance.[/quote]Whilst i agree with all ur sentiments in this thread, at my college they had IE removed from the boxes and replaced with FF.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Explorer 9
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Scratch that, I didn’t even take a look at IE 9 before I made that post. I must say that the browser looks much better than it had been for 9999 years. Being able to perform better than other major browsers is a milestone for Microsoft. Let’s see if Firefox 4 can outshine IE 9 when it’s released.

I’ll just remain a Chromium fag on Linux though.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Explorer 9
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I’d actually consider it good news. People, especially those who implement systems in large networks like colleges, schools, universities, etc, choose internet explorer over and over again, for whatever reason.

IE9 is a much better browser than previous versions, and because it will hold a large portion of the market (eventually) at least that portion will be using a decent browser now. After Microsoft waking up and realising they have some catching up to do, I’m willing to give them a chance.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Explorer 9
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:16, topic:386543”]
Even disregarding that, it is a new version of the internet browser that holds the most market share. Even if it is loosing that grip and regardless of your opinions of it, I’m not sure how it would be considered anything but bad news. [/quote]
That is the truth.

Read full topic

cumescape:

Is this really news?[/quote][quote=“Thug-life, post:5, topic:386543”]Microsoft have been going through a little rethink over the past two years, and have been taking new approaches to a fair few key products.

[/quote]

item.title: Internet Explorer 9
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I think they mainly did it too encourage users to move towards upgrading which would then increase sale. I really have no problem with xp but thats because its what I grew up with I guess. Its just time to move on I have been using windows 7 since its release and havent had any problems.

Ontopic: I have been using IE 9 and its not bad at all I like it alot better than IE8 which was shit as far as the UI went.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Explorer 9
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Them continuing to support XP would be a bad thing. It gives people continued incentive to keep using XP and not upgrade, why would you want people using a 10 year old operating system?

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Explorer 9
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

yeah they’re improving, but the fact they don’t support XP despite the huge marketshare it still has makes it almost pointless.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Explorer 9
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

PCWorld

Four Ways IE9 Lets You Surf Safer

Sure, IE9 is faster and integrates the Windows desktop with the Web, but it also includes features to let you surf the Web more securely.

There has been a rather large hype about Internet Explorer being, well, “better” “safer” “download it now cus its best browser omg”…

Read full topic
